revised_title: Temperature Observations in Europe during Late 1767 and Early 1768
tldr: In a letter to Reverend Nevil Maskelyne, Peter Wargentin, Secretary of the Royal Academy of Sciences at Stockholm, shares temperature observations recorded using Reaumur's thermometer from November 1767 to January 1768. The coldest temperature was recorded on January 2nd, with mercury at 17.2 degrees below freezing. Wargentin notes that the cold was moderate for the region.
